commoncliches.quote: A problem shared is a problem cut in half.
Ask for help.
Better them than me.
Changing addictions is like switching seats on the Titanic.
Do the footwork.
Do the next right thing.
Doing the deal.
Don't call me after you drink; call me before you drink.
Don't leave before the miracle happens.
Don't let other people's words define you.
Don't let people rent space in your head.
Don't think, don't drink, and go to meetings.
Easy does it.
F.E.A.R. - False Evidence Appearing Real
Fake it 'till you make it.
Feeling comfortable in your own skin.
First things first.
Get out of yourself.
G.O.D. - Good Orderly Direction.
G.O.D. - Group of Drunks.
God doesn't give is what we want; God gives us what we need.
Half measures availed us nothing.
Have an attitude of gratitude.
H.O.W - Honest, Open, and Willing.
Ican't; He can; I think I'll let him.
I didn't get into trouble every time I drank; but every time I got in trouble I was drinking.
I have problems in areas where I used to not have any areas.
I was sick and tired of being sick and tired.
I was tired of the ass-kicking machine.
If I could drink like a normal person, I'd drink everyday.
If nothing changes, nothing changes.
If you are not completely satisfied with AA, your misery will be promptly refunded.
If you don't do a fourth, you'll probably drink a fifth.
If you don't drink, you won't get drunk.
If you don't get this program, stick around until it gets you.
If you don't have a sponsor, your addiction will gladly sponsor you.
If you don't remember your last drunk, you haven't had it yet.
If you hang out in a barbershop, you might just gey a haircut.
If you think you don't have a lower bottom, remember there's always a trap door.
If you're neck deep in shit, it's okay to piss your pants.
In sobriety, there are good times and growth times.
Insanity is doing the same thing over and over again expecting different results.
I doesn't matter what you think, or what you feel; it matters what you do.
It takes what it takes.
It works if you work it.
It's easier to put on slippers than carpet the world.
It's no fun having a belly full of alcohol, if you have a head full of AA.
Keep coming back.
Keep it simple.
Let go and let God.
Live and let Live.
Look for the similarities, not at the differences.
Meeting makers make it.
My disease wants to kill me.
Ninety in ninety.
No 13th stepping.
No one comes into AA on a winning streak.
One day at a time.
One is too many and a thousand is not enough.
Play the tape all the way through.
Poor me, poor me, pour me another drink.
Relapse is a process, not an event.
Stark raving sober.
Stay away from wet faces and wet places.
Stick with the winners.
Stinkin' Thinkin'.
Surrender to win.
Take suggestions.
Take the cotton wool out of your ears and put it in your mouth.
The first step is the only one you have to work perfectly.
There is only one thing you have to change - and that's everything.
They call it Alcohol-'ism', not Alcohol-'wasm'.
This disease is bigger than me, but it's not bigger than us.
This is a disease, not a disgrace.
This is a program for people who want it, not for people who need it.
This is a selfish program.
This is a simple program for complicated people.
This is a 'we' program.
This program is simple, not easy.
This too shall pass.
Trust the process.
Turn it over.
Wait a year.
We are not bad people trying to get good, we are sick people trying to get well.
We don't trip over mountains; we trip over molehills.
We get sick by ourselves; we get well together.
We have a disease that tells us; we don't have a disease.
Whatever you put in front of your sobriety is the first thing you're going to lose.
When all else fails, working with another alcoholic saves the day.
When you get hit by a train, it's not the caboose that kills you.
Where's your higher power?
While you work on recovery, your addiction is doing push ups.
Work the steps.
You can carry the message; you can't carry the alcoholic.
You can take a bath in champagne as long as you don't drink it.
You can't save your face and your ass at the same time.
You can't think your way into better living, but you can live your way into better thinking.
You don't go to a whorehouse to get a ham sandwich.
You have to give it away to keep it.
Your best thinking got you here.
You're on a pink cloud.
